item.title: Issue with upgrading Project Accounting and Purchase Order
item.description:
A recent upgrade from GP9 to GP10 resulted in an unexpected issue: purchase order line items were missing account numbers. This was perplexing because previous upgrades, even those involving project accounting, had gone smoothly. The problem became evident when a user discovered that upon receiving purchase orders, no Cost of Goods Sold account defaulted. This was because the purchase order line items lacked account numbers. Database examination confirmed that the INVINDX field, which stores account indexes for purchase order lines in the POP10110 table, was empty for all 7500 lines...
Read The Full Article :https://Nexus-Security.github.io/issue-with-upgrading-project-accounting-and-purchase-order/

item.title: Issue with Project Accounting Cost Category and Fee ID
item.description:
Last week, a client contacted me with a peculiar problem in Project Accounting. While their actual billings and payments/receipts matched in summary and detail, running the Cash Apply reconciliation (Tools»Routines»Project»PA Reconcile) incorrectly recalculated the payments/receipts as less than the actual billings. This discrepancy, equal to the “FREIGHT” fee charged on projects, was especially noticeable on projects with a single invoice and payment. We investigated the database, comparing the “FREIGHT” fee setup to other fees, but found no differences...

item.title: Tracking assets for project accounting.
item.description:
Many clients are using Microsoft Dynamics GP’s Project Accounting module in unconventional ways, often because it’s included in their software suite. One example is using it to track capital expenditures, effectively managing the various costs associated with a capital project, such as labor, materials, and overhead. A common question is how to manage asset “recognition” when a project reaches a certain completion stage and construction in progress (CIP) becomes capitalized. We can address this by utilizing the Work in Progress (WIP) function within Project Accounting, employing a time and materials project to simulate the transfer of expenses from a CIP account to an asset account...
